1.description: An overview of the lab activities.
1.directions: In this lab, you will dilute a standard solution to prepare solutions of different concentrations, including a blank solution.

2.description: Select all the required apparatus and chemicals from the cabinet.
2.directions: First, take out all the apparatus and chemicals needed for the lab from the cabinet.

3.description: Transfer a small amount of the standard solution from the volumetric flask to a clean beaker.
3.directions: Pour a small amount of standard solution from the volumetric flask into a clean beaker for pipetting.

4.description: Decide whether to use a glass pipette or a micropipette for transferring the solution.
4.directions: Select either a glass pipette or a micropipette for transferring the reagents.
4.user_instructions: Click on either the glass pipette or the micropipette to select it.

5.description: Select the appropriate glass pipette for transferring 10 mL of solution.
5.directions: Choose the correct glass pipette for transferring 10 mL of solution.

6.description: Attach a suction device to the glass pipette.
6.directions: Attach the pipette filler to the glass pipette.

7.description: Use the pipette filler to draw up 10 mL of the solution.
7.directions: Use the pipette filler to draw the solution into the pipette until the bottom of the meniscus reaches the 10 mL calibration mark.
7.user_instructions: Use the pipette filler controls to draw the solution to the 10 mL mark, observing the meniscus in the second camera view.

8.description: Transfer the 10 mL aliquot from the pipette into a 100 mL volumetric flask.
8.directions: Dispense the solution from the pipette into the 100 mL volumetric flask.
8.user_instructions: Allow the pipette to drain completely into the volumetric flask.

mistakes.mistakeDescription: Did not allow pipette to drain completely
mistakes.correctAnswer: Let pipette drain completely without blowing out

9.description: Add distilled water to the volumetric flask up to the calibration mark.
9.directions: Add distilled water to the volumetric flask until the bottom of the meniscus reaches the calibration mark.
9.user_instructions: Pour distilled water carefully, then use the dropper to adjust the level precisely.

10.description: Use a dropper to add water dropwise to reach the calibration mark precisely.
10.directions: Use the dropper to add water until the bottom of the meniscus reaches the calibration mark.
10.user_instructions: Add water dropwise while observing the meniscus in the second camera view.

11.description: Place a stopper on the volumetric flask and mix the solution by gentle inversion.
11.directions: Place the stopper on the flask and mix the solution by inverting the flask gently several times.
11.user_instructions: Click on the stopper to place it on the flask, then click the flask to mix the solution.

12.description: Repeat the dilution process to prepare solutions of different concentrations.
12.directions: Repeat the steps to prepare additional solutions with different volumes of stock solution according to the provided data set.
12.user_instructions: Follow the same procedure to prepare solutions of varying concentrations.

13.description: Prepare a blank solution containing all reagents except the analyte.
13.directions: Prepare a blank solution by following the same procedure but without adding the analyte.

14.description: You have completed the dilution lab.
14.directions: Congratulations! You have successfully prepared the solutions.
